column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Anything else you want to add ?
#Text=Anything else I want to add …
#Text=My wife Liz and I are running for president as “ concerned parents from the Midwest . ”

#Text=What we ’re concerned about is the alarming increase in climate change , the scary levels of nuclear proliferation ( including in this country , even with the new treaty with Russia ) , mounting violence in our inner cities and stark abject poverty in the Third World .
#Text=Then there ’s astronomical national debt , 4,000 babies being killed in their mothers ’ wombs here each day , endless war , terrorism …

#Text=During Campaign 2004 , I told a newspaper reporter in La Cross , that I did n’t want to be sitting on my death bed someday , staring our children in the eye and saying : “ I knew all this stuff was going on , but I was too busy making money . ”
#Text=So our family gave up our normal lives and took to the roads of America to look for solutions to these dilemmas .
#Text=And we found them , in the most unlikely of places at that .
#Text=We found how to balance the National Budget in tiny Atwood ( pop . 1,500 ) .
#Text=We found how to stop abortion in Portland .
#Text=We found how to end nuclear proliferation in Luck .
#Text=We found how to stop terrorism in w : Comers , Georgia .
#Text=And we found how to realign most of the rest of America
#Text=in Bluffton ( pop . 3,857 ) , ‘ America ’s best town . ’
#Text=and And as these were the most unlikely of places , the people behind the projects were often the most unlikely of people .
#Text=That is , they were often common sense people with the common good in mind .
#Text=Not profit .
#Text=Not fame .
#Text=Just the common good .
#Text=We ’ve done , maybe , more than 1,000 interviews with these types of people .
#Text=And from these interviews , as I mentioned before , we ’ve developed a solid platform .
#Text=The best platform out there for where the country needs to go at this point , we believe .

#Text=You see , in the face of all the pressing problems I describe at the outset of this particular answer , a lot of the current policies seem to me to be “ rearranging deck chairs on the Titanic . ”
#Text=What we need is leadership at this point that can steer the boat away from the iceberg altogether , and quick .
#Text=( That is , ironically enough , if there ’s going to be any iceberg ’s left in the wake of global warming . )
#Text=Our common sense platform does that , in spades .
#Text=So Americans have a choice this next election .
#Text=They can go with yet another Ivy League type choice , contemplating the refrain : “ If you always do what you ’ve always done , you ’ll always get what you ’ve always got . ”

#Text=Or they can go with this quite “ average ” family from Cleveland , who will bring good old fashion common sense ( think Mr. Smith Goes to Washington ) to a White House that will look , oh , a bit different — including perhaps even the color .
#Text=I mean knowing my wife ( soon to be First Lady ) , she ’ll have me painting stuff there on the weekends .
#Text=I ’m thinking about going with , like , a soft green on the outside .
#Text=-- Joe
#Text=P.S. Do n’t let the occasional humor fool you .
#Text=This is , indeed , a very serious attempt by an average citizen to run for president .
#Text=And would n’t it be refreshing if someone like me won ?
